column1: Just got back and thought I would share some thoughts. I’m no expert, but I have first hand experience and not just someone posting every link they can find. I mean if it is on the internet, it has to be true, right?Any case we arrived on Sunday and had a fabulous time. Traveled from Playa del Carmen to the hotel zone with multiple stops along the way. Used Taxi, colectivo, bus. All pretty normal. Hotels were running low occupancy but still operating normally. Things seemed to change yesterday when we were departing. Seemed like half the hotel was checking out. I’m guessing the state department warning panicked the American travelers. The airport yesterday was busy. More so than It was when we arrived, but not any worse than a spring day. Check in, security, boarding, all the same. They did ask questions and there was a joke of a thermal screening, but other than that nothing out of the ordinary. There were a few people wearing masks. I mean very few. Pretty much everyone we encountered had the same view that things are being blown way out of proportion and a massive overreaction. This was the mindset of locals and tourists alike. I don’t know what the future holds for my friends in Cancun, but my fear is the the economic fall out will create conditions much worse than a few people getting sick. The workers were already working reduced schedules and there isn’t much of unemployment support and these people live mostly paycheck to paycheck. Overall it was a great trip. Hope that someday we can return.
“a few people getting sick“Let’s revisit this comment in a few months when the new case count dwarfs the current number
What was it like at Your Home airport? Any changes there?

Blown way out of proportion...Read any story about the conditions in Italian hospitals, and you will know that this isn't being blown out of proportion. Hospitals in the US are reusing protective equipment, Doctors are getting sick.Glad you made it home safe, because you don't want to be in Mexico if/when they start getting a lot of cases. Their medical system will be quickly overwhelmed.I know you are not taking this seriously, but for everyone else's benefit, follow instructions to stay home.Edited: 10:15 am, March 21, 2020

You are on another planet. This is not about “a few people getting sick”. This virus is very contagious and with about 15% of those affected requiring hospitalizations, it can quickly overburden any health system. You may not care about your health but at least take precautions not to endanger others.Edited: 10:28 am, March 21, 2020

Most Mexicans live very poorly, and do not have the disposable income to travel much, buy pallets of toilet paper. So mostly stay home with family. Even on vacation. All of my friends here are just staying home, and not going out of their homes.

I am glad you made it home, and hope that you stay healthy. I would also be interested in how the US airports were. Did you have a direct flight?Currently we are sitting on our 4/24 trip to Costa Rica. We have NO INTENTION of traveling, as I live in upstate NY and the cases are high in downstate NY. But...since insurance doesn't cover pandemics there is no immediate need to worry about canceling. Things will play out-it appears that our Atlanta to Costa Rica leg of the trip has been put on suspension anyway.Stay safe and healthy everyone!!

While the person tested positive, he also was recovering from cancer and had a host of other problems. Corona was the least of his issues, but it sensationalizes the story and stirs up fear. I could sit here and post links but instead I like to see things for myself. I have seen it and I’m not worried.I am more worried about the impact on the poor. Undoubtedly there will be looting and violence when money runs out because no one is working. That is a much worse alternative than a busy hospital.

(business was slow). Her English was excellent and she told me she just came back home from working in Canada because the sense of panic was just too much for her there.

“...the midpoint of estimate flu deaths this season is 41,000”I know numbers bore people but since this was brought up it should be put in context. The mortality rate for the seasonal flu is 0.1 %, or 1 in a 1000 cases. For Covid it’s 1 % at its lowest, or 1 in 100 cases. Ten times the rate. In Italy it’s as high as 8%. I don’t know about you but when my chances of dying is ten times greater (at best) than from the flu I think it’s a little more than “media driven hysteria.” But to be honest, I really wish that’s all it is. I’d love for this to be just one big mass hysteria.

“How about 36,560 motor vehicle deaths in a year? Shut down driving to prevent those deaths?”Car accidents occur year-round. Hospitals are not overwhelmed with a massive number of car accident victims all at once. We are trying to do the same with covid-19 by flattening the curve. It’s not a difficult concept to understand

"For Covid it’s 1 % at its lowest, or 1 in 100 cases."That is why those at risk need to bear the brunt of measures taken to protect themselves...or for those in care facilities, taken by staff to protect them.
I don’t know where the 1% number is from but thats not what i see online from trusted sites

Covid also has a hospitalization rate of about 15%. It cam quickly overburden any health system.As for those saying things along the lines of “Do what YOU think is right for you and your family.” There is both and individual and collective responsibility to tale measures to limit/slow the spread of this virus. People ignoring recommendations of authorities are simply pushing governments to impose more and more restrictions on everyone.

Meanwhile, I hope this is reason for hope. 12 cases identified so far in the region with all of them being from folks getting it from somewhere else or people directly connected to them. Here’s praying the heat and humidity slow Community transmission in the area. You have to think there’s something to that or with all the visitors from potential hotspots that Cancun has had already.https:/…2020.html

I just wish healthcare providers had the PPE we need. I’m being asked to reuse N95 masks. It’s pretty alarming. 3 of my coworkers including an ER doc are ill now. What’s bad is that our docs and RN’s aren’t all young, so us experienced oldies are already higher risk. We are all fighting the good fight together tho. I just ask everyone to be safe and to help protect the healthcare workers who may be taking care of you or someone you love in the near future. Oh and if anyone who works construction or does sanding/woodworking projects has any of those boxes of 3M or Milwaukee N95 masks consider donating to a local ER. Call them first. Thanks everyone and stay safe.

Now as we start to see testing numbers go up it will be natural to see positive results too. It’s really all about the asymptomatic spread of this thing. We have so many patient's telling us they were perfectly fine one day then boom, sick as all get out the next day. That’s unlike the flu were you can feel crappy for a few days before it gets worse. Alot of folks have zero symptoms and by current data this virus may have a 5 day asymptomatic contagious timeframe. I work at a major hospital in Chicago as an RN

”don’t know where the 1% number is from but thats not what i see online from trusted sites”Fatality rates vary. That’s why I said 1% at best. South Korea is about 1% but most countries are much higher. Globally it’s 4%. I guess my point was that even at its best, Covid is 10x more deadly than the seasonal flu. But that’s at its best.

I agree the testing is probably low, but you would think with the number of foreign visitors slammed into tight resorts, eating buffet, handing drink glasses to the wait staff, etc would have spread the disease like wildfire in the region and there would have been more evidence of an outbreak in the region by now. The hospitals would have seen more of an uptake in admissions at least and would be packed with possible cases (maybe they are and it’s all a cover up for all I know?)
Google CEBM. Center for evidence based medicine. They are keeping track of death percentages from around the globe.

Most mild cases in those over 40 aren’t as mild as people think in terms of symptoms.

Let’s not forget that Italy has the second oldest population in the world and therefore they’re more likely to have folks who are susceptible to this virus and there towns / cities are mostly clustered together causing the virus to be transmitted more easily. It should also be mentioned that most people recover from this virus something around 85% or so and another fact in 2018 60k Americans alone died from the flu just for perspective. I do hope that this is being blown out of proportion and that the world can go back to what it use to be very soon.
